The consequences of unprincipled behavio: The people of town and country become unprincipled
The courses of the moon and sun become erratic
The courses of the stars and constellations become erratic
The days and nights become erratic
The months and fortnights become erratic
The seasons and years become erratic
The blowing of the winds becomes erratic and chaotic
The heavens donâ€™t provide enough rain
People become short-lived, ugly, weak, and sickly when they eat crops that have ripened erratically
The consequences of principled behavior: The people of town and country become principled
The courses of the sun and moon become regular
The courses of the stars and constellations become regular
The days and nights become regular
The months and fortnights become regular
The seasons and years become regular
The blowing of the winds becomes regular and orderly
The heavens provide plenty of rain
People become long-lived, beautiful, strong, and healthy when they eat crops that have ripened well
The behavior of a leader and its impact: The rest of the group behaves badly
The whole country sleeps badly when the king is unprincipled
The leader does the right thing
The rest of the group does the right thing
The whole country sleeps at ease when the king is just.
